remarks: The subspace topology of an order topology is in general finer than the topology generated by the restricted order, but we do have inclusion in one direction.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)  (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 11-Sep-2018.)
statement:
ordtNEW.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
ordtNEW.l $e |- .<_ = ( ( le ` K ) i^i ( B X. B ) ) $.
ordtrestNEW $p |- ( ( K e. Preset /\ A C_ B ) -> ( ordTop ` ( .<_ i^i ( A X. A ) ) ) C_ ( ( ordTop ` .<_ ) |`t A ) ) $.
